714932f-a.title: Manhattan: 100th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
714932f-a.text:
410 East 100th Street, south east corner of lst Avenue,
show'ng P.'. 99.
Board of Education, N.Y.C.

722914f-a.title: Manhattan: 100th Street (West) - 1st Avenue
722914f-a.text:
Niverside Park, at West 100th Street, showing the terrain to the south (No. 1) and to the north (No. 2)
of this point.
Across the foreground are the New york Central Railroad tracks. Note the U. S. Training Ship "Illinois anchored at 98th Street. This shortly will be moved to
135th Street.
On the Hudson River appear armed vellsels of the LN. S. Mavy and small boats taking visitors to same.
The background is the New Jersey shore.
June 10, 1934
Views: 1-2
L. Sperr

714931f-a.title: Manhattan: 100th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
714931f-a.text:
East 100th Street, west from First Avenue, showing pavement conditions on the south side of the street. View 2 details the north side at a point closer to SecOnd Avenue.
May 4, 1937
No's. 1-2
W. P. A., photo
Five Boroughs Project

714931f-b.text:

No's. 1-2

707679f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 100th St.
707679f-a.text:
First Ave., north from East 100th Street, showing a portion of the
wholesale (to peddlers) produce market.
March 29, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
